dt: {bc}metal in the form of a usually very flexible thread or slender rod
{bc}a thread or rod of such material
{bc}the meshwork of parallel or woven wire on which the wet web of paper forms
{bc}something (such as a thin plant stem) that is {a_link|wirelike}
{bc}a system of {a_link|wires} used to operate the puppets in a puppet show
{bc}hidden influences controlling the action of a person or organization
{bc}a line of wire for conducting electric current {dx}compare {dxt|cord||3b}{/dx}
{bc}a telephone or telegraph wire or system
{bc}fencing or a fence of usually barbed wire
{bc}the final decisive moment (as of a contest)

dt.t: the negotiations came down to the {wi}wire{/wi}

et: Middle English {it}wir, wyre,{/it} going back to Old English {it}wīr,{/it} going back to Germanic {it}*wīra-,{/it} whence Middle Low German {it}wire{/it} "flexible metal, filigree," Old Norse {it}vír-,{/it} in {it}víravirki{/it} "filigree work," and (with presumed lowering of {it}ī{/it} to {it}ē{sup}2{/sup}{/it} before {it}r{/it}) Old High German {it}wiara, wiera{/it} "fine gold, ornament of gold filigree," going back to a nominal derivative with a suffix {it}-r-{/it} from Indo-European {it}*u̯ei̯H-{/it} "plait, wrap," whence Latin {it}vieō, viēre{/it} "to plait, weave," Old Church Slavic {it}poviti{/it} "to wrap up, bind," Lithuanian {it}výti{/it} "to twist," and probably to Sanskrit {it}vyayati{/it} "(it) covers, envelops," {it}vīta-{/it} "covered, hidden"
shortdef: metal in the form of a usually very flexible thread or slender rod
a thread or rod of such material

dt: {bc}to provide with wire {bc}use wire on for a specific purpose
{bc}to send or send word to by telegraph
{bc}to connect by or as if by a wire
{bc}to predispose, determine, or establish genetically or innately

dt.t: controversy over the extent to which human violence is {it}wired{/it} biologically

et: Middle English {it}*wiren{/it} (in past participle {it}y-wyred{/it}), derivative of {it}wyr, wire{/it} {et_link|wire:1|wire:1}
shortdef: to provide with wire : use wire on for a specific purpose
to send or send word to by telegraph
